welcome_message: Hey! Need help with your homework?
bot_help: Hey, How can I help you?
business_problem:
A small business sells handmade notebooks.
• Each notebook sells for $10.
• The cost to produce them is $4 per notebook.
• There is also a fixed monthly cost of $200 for rent and utilities.
1. Write an equation for the business's profit P in terms of the number of notebooks sold x.
2. Plot the equation on a graph to show the break-even point.
profit_hint:
Hint:
1. The profit formula is: P(x) = (10-4)x - 200
2. The break-even point happens when P(x)=0
